newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai May sugar exports down 8.8 pct yr-on-yr.
newsitem.headline: Thai May sugar exports down 8.8 pct yr-on-yr.

text.p: Thailand's sugar exports dropped 8.8 percent to 498,287 tonnes in May from the corresponding period in 1996, according to independent surveyors.
Of the total, 403,830 tonnes were raw, 60,540 tonnes white, 33,900 tonnes refined and the rest brown, they said.
But the quantity exported improved marginally from April when the country moved 465,213 tonnes of sugar.
South Korea which bought 135,950 tonnes of raw sugar, was the biggest importer of Thai sugar for the month, followed by Malaysia and China which bought 80,600 tonnes and 62,252 tonnes respectively.
Ukraine and Russia entered the market after staying on the sidelines in April and bought moderate amounts each.
